title: Nine News (radio)
text:
Nine News is a radio news service providing the half-hourly radio <a href="news">news</a> bulletins to radio stations across Australia. 
History.
On 16 September 2009, the company shut down its news website, livenews.com.au after two years of existence citing poor financial returns.
In April 2015, following the merger of Macquarie Radio Network and Fairfax Radio Network, the newsroom of <a href="2UE">2UE</a> Sydney was closed and replaced with the <a href="2GB">2GB</a> feed. Local bulletins on <a href="3AW">3AW</a>, <a href="4BC">4BC</a> and <a href="6PR">6PR</a> now take the Macquarie National News branding.
In July, the newsroom shared between <a href="1116%20SEN">1116 SEN</a> and <a href="3MP">3MP 1377</a> in Melbourne was closed, replaced with the Macquarie National News service from 3AW.
On 1 January 2020, the service was replaced by <a href="Nine%20News">Nine News</a>, which commenced providing the half-hourly radio <a href="news">news</a> bulletins to radio stations across Australia. 
Stations.
Bold signifies a Nine Radio owned station.
